entry.title: An Opportunity to Serve Again!
entry.summary:
I served for 26 years in the U.S Navy. Upon my retirement in 2011, I worked as an Project Engineer and Maintenance Manager. I saw an opportunity with the Defense Contract Management Agency (DCMA) as a Quality Assurance Engineer and was hired last January.

more
entry.content:
I served for 26 years in the U.S Navy. Upon my retirement in 2011, I worked as an Project Engineer and Maintenance Manager. I saw an opportunity with the Defense Contract Management Agency (DCMA) as a Quality Assurance Engineer and was hired last January.

Read Full Post

entry.title: Resilient!
entry.summary:
I served in the Air Force in the communications field for over 5 years and upon honorably separating, I enrolled into a 4-year college and was able to find employment at the university through the VA's work-study program.

more
entry.content:
I served in the Air Force in the communications field for over 5 years and upon honorably separating, I enrolled into a 4-year college and was able to find employment at the university through the VA's work-study program.

Read Full Post

entry.title: USDA Helps Veterans Return to the Workforce
entry.summary: Operation Warfighter is a unique federal internship program that allows recovering service members to begin the transition to the civilian workforce while still on active duty status and undergoing rehabilitation. more
entry.content:
Operation Warfighter is a unique federal internship program that allows recovering service members to begin the transition to the civilian workforce while still on active duty status and undergoing rehabilitation.

entry.title: Compliance Safety & Health Officer
entry.summary: HI!, my name is Saul Charles and I am a proud veteran who served in the United States Navy & Army for a total of 10 years of military service. I was honorably discharged from the military service settling in Virginia. more
entry.content:
HI!, my name is Saul Charles and I am a proud veteran who served in the United States Navy & Army for a total of 10 years of military service. I was honorably discharged from the military service settling in Virginia.

entry.title: IT Specialist - Department of the Army
entry.summary: Hello, My name is Mitesh Patel. I was born in India. I came to the USA in 1999. I had a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Engineering from the University of Pune, India. more

entry.title: Justin Johnson's Story
entry.summary: I am a combat medic. I deployed with the 2ID to Baghdad 06 to 07. I was hired under a pilot program to hire veterans. I am an Intermediate Care Technician working in the Emergency Room at a Veteran Hospital using my hard earned skills and combat experience to help veterans! more
entry.content:
I am a combat medic. I deployed with the 2ID to Baghdad 06 to 07. I was hired under a pilot program to hire veterans. I am an Intermediate Care Technician working in the Emergency Room at a Veteran Hospital using my hard earned skills and combat experience to help veterans!

Read Full Post

entry.title: COAST GUARD TO DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS
entry.summary:
Joined the USCG at 18 right out of HS in NYC. I retired in 2007 in San Diego after spending the last 11 years as a Coast Guard Recruiter. I moved to San Antonio, TX with my wife during terminal leave based on some good advice from a coworker.

more
entry.content:
Joined the USCG at 18 right out of HS in NYC. I retired in 2007 in San Diego after spending the last 11 years as a Coast Guard Recruiter. I moved to San Antonio, TX with my wife during terminal leave based on some good advice from a coworker.

Read Full Post

entry.title: Mission Accomplished
entry.summary:
I am an Honorably Discharged Veteran of the United States Army Signal Corp. After my time served in 1981, it was my goal to become a Social Worker and work for the Federal Government and with fellow veterans in some capacity.

more
entry.content:
I am an Honorably Discharged Veteran of the United States Army Signal Corp. After my time served in 1981, it was my goal to become a Social Worker and work for the Federal Government and with fellow veterans in some capacity.

entry.title: Contract Specialist - COPPER CAP

entry.title: Physical Therapist Assistant
entry.summary:
I retired from the Navy in 1997 with the rank of Senior Chief Petty Officer. My rate was Boatswain's Mate and I was a deep sea saturation diver 17 of my 24 years of active service. Many of my collateral duties involved counseling or educating young sailors.

more
entry.content:

entry.title: John Burke's Story
entry.summary: I served in the U.S. Navy submarine service during the Cold War aboard the USS Puffer SSN 652, a 637 class fast attack nuclear submarine, on deployments off the coast of Hawaii and the former Soviet Union, including during the Chernobyl nuclear accident. more
entry.content:
I served in the U.S. Navy submarine service during the Cold War aboard the USS Puffer SSN 652, a 637 class fast attack nuclear submarine, on deployments off the coast of Hawaii and the former Soviet Union, including during the Chernobyl nuclear accident.

entry.title: Program/Management Analyst - Presidential Management Fellow
